newsitem.title: INDONESIA: PRESS DIGEST - Indonesian newspapers - Dec 5.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Indonesian newspapers - Dec 5.

text.p: The following are the leading stories in the Indonesian press on December 5. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
Central Bank Governor Soedradjad Djiwandono said the ideal interest rate for the Indonesian economy would be somewhere between 12 and 14 percent.
Research and Technology Minister Jusuf Habibie said he did not forsee political instability after President Suharto has relinquished his presidency of the republic.

Research and Technology Minister Jusuf Habibie, who is also head of the influential Association of Islamic Intellectuals, reported President Jaques Chirac of France as saying Indonesian Islam was both moderate and modern.
President Suharto said he would not allow conglomerates to dominate the Indonesian economy. Last month he said single share ownership in a public listed company should not exceed 15 percent.
